page.title: 04LANDSCAPE : E. RAINTON
page.content: E. RAINTON is a small village built on a hill 100 ft above sea level. It is 6 miles E. of{Durham city}and 2 miles W. from Houghton _ Le _ Spring.Most of the old houses have been knocked down and{modern houses}have been built in their places. E. Rainton was a {colliery village. Around E. Rainton there are lots of round rolling hills and lots of big fields, one field is called the {Grinders field}because a long time ago the{miller}lived in a house in a field. He ground the corn to supply the village with flour. In another field the farmer has ploughed away the public footpath. Down at the bottom of the field there is some{marsh land} with some chopped down trees. There are also lots of wild flowers.
